text: Shop drawings approved for switchgear, breakers, panels, and one-line diagram match design intent
Coordination study, arc flash analysis, and short-circuit ratings reviewed and posted on equipment
Equipment space, clearances, and working distances per CEC/CSA C22.1 or NEC as applicable
Switchboards, CDPs, and panelboards installed plumb and level, with seismic anchorage (if required)
Equipment labels, breaker identifications, and panel schedules legible and complete
Feeder cables installed with correct phasing, bend radius, torqueing of lugs per manufacturer's spec
Grounding electrode conductor (GEC), bonding conductors, and ground bus properly installed and tested
Equipment bonding verified: transformer to switchgear, panel to structure, enclosures
Breakers sized and labeled for circuit loads, AIC rating confirmed
Ground fault and arc fault protection verified where specified
Megger insulation resistance test performed on feeders and results recorded
Infrared scan performed on live gear to confirm no hotspots
Load balancing confirmed at panels and feeders
As-built one-line diagrams, torque logs, breaker settings submitted
Electrical safety signage and PPE labeling complete

id: • CSA C22.1 (CEC), CEC Section 10, NEC Article 250, NFPA 70B
• Manufacturer Specs: Eaton, Siemens, Schneider, ABB
